summary: This document is a series of emails from August 13-14, 2019, arranging a visit by U.S. Attorney's Office personnel to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The visit, scheduled for the Thursday after Jeffrey Epstein's death, was to inspect specific areas including Epstein's cell, the psych observation/suicide watch area, and the SHU, with instructions to avoid speaking to guards due to ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Ed O'Callahan
persons.context: He is listed as an additional person from the DOJ who will join the visit to the MCC.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: He is the US Attorney leading the visit request to the MCC, and he asked that the new acting warden join the tour.

connections.description: Both are DOJ officials coordinating to visit the MCC together following Epstein's death.

events.title: Planned MCC Visit by SDNY Officials
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel, including Geoffrey Berman and Ed O'Callahan, plan to visit the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect Epstein's cell, the psych observation/suicide watch area, and the SHU.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The visit was scheduled for the Thursday immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
The specific areas to be inspected included Epstein's cell (described as still cordoned off), the psych observation/suicide watch area, and the 9th floor SHU.
The visiting officials requested that only MCC legal staff escort them and explicitly stated they would not speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the MCC's legal counsel to arrange access and logistics for the sensitive post-incident visit.
